ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: General knowledge about the field of archeology, understanding Maya hieroglyphics, a bit of historical linguistics.
Learned how to read maya hieroglyphs!
This course provided an introduction to the writing system of the ancient Maya, focused on translating existing examples of Maya writing.

Through the course I gained a surprisingly thorough understanding of Maya glyphs and by the end I was able to read glyphs much better than I expected I'd be able to. I also learned a significant amount about the context in which the glyphs were produced.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish we had done a bit more community building and getting to know the other people in the class.

Strengths: really fun material and chill professor
Weaknesses: could have used more guidance on the final paper

It was never entirely clear what we, as students, should be taking as notes during class. We looked at mant examples of Maya writing but we didn't really have opportunities to check our work from in-class translations.

Strengths: I liked the emphasis on memorizing the glyphs and being able to write them. I felt like being compelled to learn to read and write them really enhanced my overall understanding. I loved the final paper assignment. It was a great culminating assignment and a good way to show what I'd learned in the course. Professor Chinchilla was clearly very knowledgeable and I enjoyed him as a professor. Weaknesses: I would have liked some more emphasis on the nuances of Maya grammar, but we were never tested on this knowledge so it wasn't a big deal.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, such a fun class to take!

If one is a linguist, or at all interested in studying indigenous peoples of the Americas, then I would strongly recommend this course. The workload is not particularly large and so it is possible to fit inside a busy schedule.

If you're at all interested in the subject or like learning languages, then definitely. I thought the course was genuinely fascinating. One of my favorite courses at Yale. You won't have many other opportunities to learn this sort of content, so I would say that you should definitely take advantage.
